member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Authentication.NTLM.AuthenticationMessageUtils.IsNTLMv1ExtendedSessionSecurity(System.Byte[])
member.summary: If NTLM v1 Extended Session Security is used, LMResponse starts with 8-byte challenge, followed by 16 bytes of padding (set to zero).
member.remarks: LMResponse is 24 bytes for NTLM v1, NTLM v1 Extended Session Security and NTLM v2.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Authentication.NTLM.AuthenticationMessageUtils.IsNTLMv2NTResponse(System.Byte[])
member.remarks: NTLM v1 / NTLM v1 Extended Session Security NTResponse is 24 bytes.

member.param: ClientChallengeStructure with 4 zero bytes padding, a.k.a. temp

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Authentication.NTLM.NTLMCryptography.ExtendDESKey(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Extends a 7-byte key into an 8-byte key. Note: The DES key ostensibly consists of 64 bits, however, only 56 of these are actually used by the algorithm. Eight bits are used solely for checking parity, and are thereafter discarded

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Authentication.NTLM.NTLMCryptography.KXKey(System.Byte[],SMBLibrary.Authentication.NTLM.NegotiateFlags,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.remarks: If NTLM v2 is used, KeyExchangeKey MUST be set to the value of SessionBaseKey.

member.remarks: Caller must verify that the authenticate message has MIC before calling this method

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.Authentication.NTLM.NegotiateFlags.Anonymous
member.summary: If set, the connection SHOULD be anonymous

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.Authentication.NTLM.NegotiateFlags.ExtendedSessionSecurity

member.summary: When setting file attributes, a value of -1 indicates to the server that it MUST NOT change this attribute for all subsequent operations on the same file handle.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SP800_1008
member.summary: Implements the NIST SP800-108 key derivation routine in counter mode with an HMAC PRF. See: http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/800-108/sp800-108.pdf

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NetBiosSuffix
member.summary: 16th character suffix for netbios name. see http://support.microsoft.com/kb/163409/en-us

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NBTConnectionReceiveBuffer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.param: Must be large enough to hold the largest possible NBT packet

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NBTConnectionReceiveBuffer.DequeuePacket
member.summary: HasCompletePacket must be called and return true before calling DequeuePacket

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NBTConnectionReceiveBuffer.DequeuePacketBytes
member.summary: HasCompletePDU must be called and return true before calling DequeuePDUBytes

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NetBiosUtils.GetMSNetBiosName(System.String,SMBLibrary.NetBios.NetBiosSuffix)
member.summary: The NetBIOS naming convention allows for 16 characters in a NetBIOS name. Microsoft, however, limits NetBIOS names to 15 characters and uses the 16th character as a NetBIOS suffix See http://support.microsoft.com/kb/163409/en-us

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NetBiosUtils.EncodeName(System.String,System.String)
member.param: NetBIOS name
dot-separated labels, formatted per DNS naming rules

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NetBiosUtils.FirstLevelEncoding(System.String,System.String)
member.param: NetBIOS name
dot-separated labels, formatted per DNS naming rules

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NetBiosUtils.SecondLevelEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: The on-the-wire format of an NBT name. The encoding scheme replaces the familiar dot characters used in DNS names with a byte containing the length of the next label.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NetBios.NetBiosUtils.WriteNamePointer(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Will write a 2 bytes pointer to a name Note: NetBIOS implementations can only use label string pointers in Name Service packets

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.NetBios.SessionPacket
member.summary: [RFC 1002] 4.3.1. SESSION PACKET [MS-SMB2] 2.1 Transport - Direct TCP transport packet
member.remarks: We extend this implementation to support Direct TCP transport packet which utilize the unused session packet flags to extend the maximum trailer length.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.FileAttributes.Normal
member.summary: A file that does not have other attributes set. This attribute is valid only when used alone.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateDisposition.FILE_SUPERSEDE
member.summary: If the file already exists, replace it with the given file. If it does not, create the given file.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateDisposition.FILE_OPEN
member.summary: If the file already exists, open it [instead of creating a new file]. If it does not, fail the request [and do not create a new file].

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateDisposition.FILE_CREATE
member.summary: If the file already exists, fail the request [and do not create or open the given file]. If it does not, create the given file.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateDisposition.FILE_OPEN_IF
member.summary: If the file already exists, open it. If it does not, create the given file.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateDisposition.FILE_OVERWRITE
member.summary: If the file already exists, open it and overwrite it. If it does not, fail the request.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateDisposition.FILE_OVERWRITE_IF
member.summary: If the file already exists, open it and overwrite it. If it does not, create the given file.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_DIRECTORY_FILE
member.summary: The file being created or opened is a directory file. With this option, the CreateDisposition field MUST be set to FILE_CREATE, FILE_OPEN, or FILE_OPEN_IF.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_WRITE_THROUGH
member.summary: Applications that write data to the file MUST actually transfer the data into the file before any write request is considered complete. If FILE_NO_INTERMEDIATE_BUFFERING is set, the server MUST perform as if FILE_WRITE_THROUGH is set in the create request.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_SEQUENTIAL_ONLY
member.summary: This option indicates that access to the file can be sequential. The server can use this information to influence its caching and read-ahead strategy for this file. The file MAY in fact be accessed randomly, but the server can optimize its caching and read-ahead policy for sequential access.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_NO_INTERMEDIATE_BUFFERING
member.summary: The file SHOULD NOT be cached or buffered in an internal buffer by the server. This option is incompatible when the FILE_APPEND_DATA bit field is set in the DesiredAccess field.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_NON_DIRECTORY_FILE
member.summary: If the file being opened is a directory, the server MUST fail the request with STATUS_FILE_IS_A_DIRECTORY

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_NO_EA_KNOWLEDGE
member.summary: The application that initiated the client's request does not support extended attributes (EAs). If the EAs on an existing file being opened indicate that the caller SHOULD support EAs to correctly interpret the file, the server SHOULD fail this request with STATUS_ACCESS_DENIED.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_RANDOM_ACCESS
member.summary: Indicates that access to the file can be random. The server MAY use this information to influence its caching and read-ahead strategy for this file. This is a hint to the server that sequential read-ahead operations might not be appropriate on the file.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_DELETE_ON_CLOSE
member.summary: The file SHOULD be automatically deleted when the last open request on this file is closed. When this option is set, the DesiredAccess field MUST include the DELETE flag. This option is often used for temporary files.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_OPEN_BY_FILE_ID
member.summary: Opens a file based on the FileId. If this option is set, the server MUST fail the request with STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED in the Status field of the SMB Header in the server response.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_OPEN_FOR_BACKUP_INTENT
member.summary: The file is being opened or created for the purposes of either a backup or a restore operation. Thus, the server can make appropriate checks to ensure that the caller is capable of overriding whatever security checks have been placed on the file to allow a backup or restore operation to occur. The server can check for certain access rights to the file before checking the DesiredAccess field.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: When a new file is created, the file MUST NOT be compressed, even if it is on a compressed volume. The flag MUST be ignored when opening an existing file.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.CreateOptions.FILE_OPEN_NO_RECALL
member.summary: In a hierarchical storage management environment, this option requests that the file SHOULD NOT be recalled from tertiary storage such as tape. A file recall can take up to several minutes in a hierarchical storage management environment. The clients can specify this option to avoid such delays.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.ShareAccess
member.summary: No bits set = Prevents the file from being shared

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.INTFileStore
member.summary: A file store (a.k.a. object store) interface to allow access to a file system or a named pipe in an NT-like manner dictated by the SMB protocol.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.INTFileStore.NotifyChange(System.Object@,System.Object,SMBLibrary.NotifyChangeFilter,System.Boolean,System.Int32,SMBLibrary.OnNotifyChangeCompleted,System.Object)
member.summary: Monitor the contents of a directory (and its subdirectories) by using change notifications. When something changes within the directory being watched this operation is completed.
member.returns: STATUS_PENDING - The directory is being watched, change notification will be provided using callback method. STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED - The underlying object store does not support change notifications. STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE - The handle supplied is invalid.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NTFileStoreHelper.ToFileAccess(SMBLibrary.AccessMask)
member.summary: Will return desired FileAccess rights to the file data.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.NTFileStoreHelper.ToFileAccess(SMBLibrary.FileAccessMask)
member.summary: Will return desired FileAccess rights to the file data.

member.name: P:SMBLibrary.FileStreamEntry.PaddedLength
member.summary: [MS-FSCC] When multiple FILE_STREAM_INFORMATION data elements are present in the buffer, each MUST be aligned on an 8-byte boundary

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.FileLinkInformationType1
member.remarks: [MS-FSA] 2.1.5.14.6 FILE_LINK_INFORMATION_TYPE_1: Used for 32-bit local clients and the SMB1 protocol. FILE_LINK_INFORMATION_TYPE_2: Used for 64-bit local clients and the SMB2 protocol.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.FileLinkInformationType2
member.remarks: [MS-FSA] 2.1.5.14.6 FILE_LINK_INFORMATION_TYPE_1: Used for 32-bit local clients and the SMB1 protocol. FILE_LINK_INFORMATION_TYPE_2: Used for 64-bit local clients and the SMB2 protocol.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.FileRenameInformationType1
member.remarks: [MS-FSA] 2.1.5.14.11 FILE_RENAME_INFORMATION_TYPE_1: Used for 32-bit local clients and the SMB1 protocol. FILE_RENAME_INFORMATION_TYPE_2: Used for 64-bit local clients and the SMB2 protocol.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.FileRenameInformationType2
member.remarks: [MS-FSA] 2.1.5.14.11 FILE_RENAME_INFORMATION_TYPE_1: Used for 32-bit local clients and the SMB1 protocol. FILE_RENAME_INFORMATION_TYPE_2: Used for 64-bit local clients and the SMB2 protocol.

member.summary: [MS-FSCC] When setting file attributes, a value of -1 indicates to the server that it MUST NOT change this attribute for all subsequent operations on the same file handle.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.FileFsAttributeInformation.MaximumComponentNameLength
member.summary: Maximum file name component length, in bytes, supported by the specified file system. The value of this field MUST be greater than zero and MUST be no more than 510.

member.summary: Add embedded pointer deferred structure (referent) writer

member.summary: See DCE 1.1: Remote Procedure Call, Chapter 12.6 - Connection-oriented RPC PDUs

member.summary: The length of the entire PDU

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.ConnectionManager.SendSMBKeepAlive(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Some broken NATs will reply to TCP KeepAlive even after the client initiating the connection has long gone, This methods prevent such connections from hanging around indefinitely by sending an unsolicited ECHO response to make sure the connection is still alive.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.ConnectionState.CloseSessions
member.summary: Free all resources used by the active sessions in this connection

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1ConnectionState.AllocateUserID
member.summary: An open UID MUST be unique within an SMB connection. The value of 0xFFFE SHOULD NOT be used as a valid UID. All other possible values for a UID, excluding zero (0x0000), are valid.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1ConnectionState.CreateSession(System.String,System.String,System.Byte[],System.Object)
member.returns: null if all UserID values have already been allocated

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1ConnectionState.AllocateTreeID
member.summary: An open TID MUST be unique within an SMB connection. The value 0xFFFF MUST NOT be used as a valid TID. All other possible values for TID, including zero (0x0000), are valid.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1ConnectionState.AllocateFileID
member.summary: A FID returned from an Open or Create operation MUST be unique within an SMB connection. The value 0xFFFF MUST NOT be used as a valid FID. All other possible values for FID, including zero (0x0000) are valid.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1Session.AddOpenFile(System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.param: The path relative to the share

member.summary: Free all resources used by this session

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB2Session.Close
member.summary: Free all resources used by this session

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.ServerPathUtils.GetRelativeServerPath(System.String)
member.param: UNC path, e.g. '\\192.168.1.1\Shared'

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.ServerPathUtils.GetRelativeSharePath(System.String)
member.param: UNC path, e.g. '\\192.168.1.1\Shared\*'

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.Server.CachingPolicy.ManualCaching
member.summary: The client can cache files that are explicitly selected by the user for offline use. Automatic file-by-file reintegration is not allowed.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.Server.CachingPolicy.AutoCaching
member.summary: The client can automatically cache files that are used by the user for offline access. Automatic file-by-file reintegration is allowed.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.Server.CachingPolicy.VideoCaching
member.summary: The client can automatically cache files that are used by the user for offline access. Clients are permitted to work from their local cache even while online.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.Server.CachingPolicy.NoCaching
member.summary: No offline caching is allowed for this share.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMBShareCollection.GetShareFromName(System.String)
member.param: e.g. \Shared

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1.NTTransactHelper.GetNTTransactResponse(SMBLibrary.SMB1.SMB1Header,SMBLibrary.SMB1.NTTransactRequest,SMBLibrary.Server.ISMBShare,SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1ConnectionState)
member.summary: The client MUST send as many secondary requests as are needed to complete the transfer of the transaction request.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1.NTTransactHelper.GetNTTransactResponse(SMBLibrary.SMB1.SMB1Header,SMBLibrary.SMB1.NTTransactSecondaryRequest,SMBLibrary.Server.ISMBShare,SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1ConnectionState)
member.summary: There are no secondary response messages. The client MUST send as many secondary requests as are needed to complete the transfer of the transaction request.

member.param: The filename pattern to search for. This field MAY contain wildcard characters

member.summary: The client MUST send as many secondary requests as are needed to complete the transfer of the transaction request. The server MUST respond to the transaction request as a whole.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1.TransactionHelper.GetTransactionResponse(SMBLibrary.SMB1.SMB1Header,SMBLibrary.SMB1.TransactionSecondaryRequest,SMBLibrary.Server.ISMBShare,SMBLibrary.Server.SMB1ConnectionState)
member.summary: There are no secondary response messages. The client MUST send as many secondary requests as are needed to complete the transfer of the transaction request. The server MUST respond to the transaction request as a whole.

member.remarks: 'NoRemoteChangeNotify' can be set in the registry to prevent the client from sending ChangeNotify requests altogether.

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.Server.SMBServer.Start(System.Net.IPAddress,SMBLibrary.SMBTransportType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.param: The duration after which an unsolicited ECHO response will be sent if no data has been sent or received. Some broken NATs will reply to TCP KeepAlive even after the client initiating the connection has long gone, to prevent such connections from hanging around indefinitely, this parameter can be used.

member.name: P:SMBLibrary.Services.RPCPipeStream.MessageLength
member.summary: The length of the first message available in the pipe

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.SetFileDispositionInfo.DeletePending
member.summary: Indicate that a file SHOULD be deleted when it is closed.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.CloseRequest.LastTimeModified
member.summary: A value of 0x00000000 or 0xFFFFFFFF results in the server not updating the last modification time

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.CreateDirectoryRequest
member.summary: SMB_COM_CREATE_DIRECTORY Request. This command is obsolete. This command is used by Windows NT4 SP6.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.CreateDirectoryResponse
member.summary: SMB_COM_CREATE_DIRECTORY Response. This command is obsolete. This command is used by Windows NT4 SP6.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ErrorResponse
member.summary: The Command trailer of an error response message. See [MS-CIFS]3.3.4.1.2 - Sending Any Error Response Message.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.NegotiateResponse
member.summary: SMB_COM_NEGOTIATE Response, NT LAN Manager dialect

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.NegotiateResponseExtended
member.summary: SMB_COM_NEGOTIATE Response, NT LAN Manager dialect, Extended Security response

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.QueryInformationRequest
member.summary: SMB_COM_QUERY_INFORMATION Request. This command is deprecated. This command is used by Windows NT4 SP6.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.QueryInformationResponse
member.summary: SMB_COM_QUERY_INFORMATION Response. This command is deprecated. This command is used by Windows NT4 SP6.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ReadAndXRequest
member.summary: SMB_COM_READ_ANDX Request SMB 1.0: The Timeout field becomes Timeout_or_MaxCountHigh (used when the CAP_LARGE_READX capability has been negotiated)

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ReadAndXRequest.Timeout_or_MaxCountHigh
member.summary: SMB 1.0: When reading from a regular file, the field MUST be interpreted as MaxCountHigh and the two unused bytes MUST be zero. When reading from a name pipe or I/O device, the field MUST be interpreted as Timeout.

member.name: P:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ReadAndXRequest.MaxCountLarge
member.summary: The number of bytes to return when reading from a file and LargeRead is negotiated

member.name: P:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ReadAndXRequest.MaxCount
member.summary: The number of bytes to return when reading from a named pipe or LargeRead is not negotiated

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ReadAndXResponse
member.summary: SMB_COM_READ_ANDX Response SMB 1.0: The 2 reserved bytes at offset 14 become DataLengthHigh (used when the CAP_LARGE_READX capability has been negotiated)

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.SessionSetupAndXResponseExtended
member.summary: SMB_COM_SESSION_SETUP_ANDX Response, NT LAN Manager dialect, Extended Security response

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.Transaction2Request
member.summary: SMB_COM_TRANSACTION2 Request The SMB_COM_TRANSACTION2 request format is similar to that of the SMB_COM_TRANSACTION request except for the Name field. The differences are in the subcommands supported, and in the purposes and usages of some of the fields.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.Transaction2Response
member.summary: SMB_COM_TRANSACTION2 Response The SMB_COM_TRANSACTION2 response format is identical to that of the SMB_COM_TRANSACTION response.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.WriteAndXRequest
member.summary: SMB_COM_WRITE_ANDX Request SMB 1.0: The 2 reserved bytes at offset 18 become DataLengthHigh (used when the CAP_LARGE_WRITEX capability has been negotiated)

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.WriteAndXResponse
member.summary: SMB_COM_WRITE_ANDX Response SMB 1.0: The 2 reserved bytes at offset 8 become CountHigh (used when the CAP_LARGE_WRITEX capability has been negotiated)

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.WriteRequest
member.summary: SMB_COM_WRITE Request. This command is obsolete. Windows NT4 SP6 will send this command with empty data for some reason.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.WriteResponse
member.summary: SMB_COM_WRITE Response. This command is obsolete. Windows NT4 SP6 will send this command with empty data for some reason.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ExtendedFileAttributes.Normal
member.summary: The file has no other attributes set. This attribute is valid only if used alone.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.HeaderFlags2.ExtendedSecurity
member.summary: Indicates that the client or server supports extended security

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.LockType.CANCEL_LOCK
member.summary: Request to cancel all outstanding lock requests for the specified FID and PID.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.LockType.LARGE_FILES
member.summary: Indicates that the LOCKING_ANDX_RANGE format is the 64-bit file offset version. If this flag is not set, then the LOCKING_ANDX_RANGE format is the 32-bit file offset version

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.Capabilities.ExtendedSecurity
member.summary: The server supports extended security for authentication

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.SecurityMode.UserSecurityMode
member.summary: If clear, the server supports only Share Level access control. If set, the server supports only User Level access control.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.SecurityMode.EncryptPasswords
member.summary: If clear, the server supports only plaintext password authentication. If set, the server supports challenge/response authentication. Note: Windows 2000 and above do not support plain-text passwords by default.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.NTCreateFlags.NT_CREATE_REQUEST_OPLOCK
member.summary: If set, the client requests an exclusive OpLock.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.NTCreateFlags.NT_CREATE_REQUEST_OPBATCH
member.summary: If set, the client requests an exclusive batch OpLock.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.OpenFlags.REQ_ATTRIB
member.summary: If this bit is set, the client requests that the file attribute data in the response be populated. All fields after the FID in the response are also populated. If this bit is not set, all fields after the FID in the response are zero.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.OpenFlags.REQ_OPLOCK
member.summary: Client requests an exclusive OpLock on the file.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.OpenFlags.REQ_OPLOCK_BATCH
member.summary: Client requests a Batch OpLock on the file.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.OpenFlags.SMB_OPEN_EXTENDED_RESPONSE
member.summary: SMB 1.0 Addition. If set, the client is requesting the extended format of the response.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ResourceType.FileTypeCommDevice
member.summary: OpenAndX Response: Valid. OpenAndX Extended Response: Invalid (SMB 1.0). NTCreateAndX Response: Valid. NTCreateAndX Extended Response: Invalid (SMB 1.0). Transact2Open2: Was never valid

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.ResourceType.FileTypeUnknown
member.summary: OpenAndX Response: Valid NTCreateAndX Response: Invalid Transact2Open2 Response: Valid TransactCreate Response: Valid

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.OptionalSupportFlags.SMB_SUPPORT_SEARCH_BITS
member.summary: The server supports the use of SMB_FILE_ATTRIBUTES exclusive search attributes in client requests.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.TreeConnectFlags.DisconnectTID
member.summary: If set and SMB_Header.TID is valid, the tree connect specified by the TID in the SMB header of the request SHOULD be disconnected when the server sends the response. If this tree disconnect fails, then the error SHOULD be ignored If set and TID is invalid, the server MUST ignore this bit.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.TreeConnectFlags.ExtendedSignatures
member.summary: SMB 1.0 addition. If set, then the client is requesting signing key protection.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.TreeConnectFlags.ExtendedResponse
member.summary: SMB 1.0 addition. If set, then the client is requesting extended information in the SMB_COM_TREE_CONNECT_ANDX response.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.NTTransactSubcommandName
member.summary: This is the Function field in SMB_COM_NT_TRANSACT request

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.SMB1Message
member.summary: Each message has a single header and either a single command or multiple batched (AndX) commands. Multiple command requests or responses can be sent in a single message.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.WriteThroughMode.WriteThrough
member.summary: Write-through mode. If this flag is set, then no read ahead or write behind is allowed on this file or device. When the response is returned, data is expected to be on the disk or device.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.Open2Flags.REQ_ATTRIB
member.summary: Return additional information in the response; populate the CreationTime, FileDataSize, AccessMode, ResourceType, and NMPipeStatus fields in the response.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.Open2Flags.REQ_EASIZE
member.summary: Return total length of Extended Attributes (EAs); populate the ExtendedAttributeLength field in the response.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.PipeState.ReadMode
member.summary: If set, the named pipe is operating in message mode. If not set, the named pipe is operating in byte mode. In message mode, the system treats the bytes read or written in each I/O operation to the pipe as a message unit. The system MUST perform write operations on message-type pipes as if write-through mode were enabled.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.PipeState.Nonblocking
member.summary: If set, a read or a raw read request returns all data available to be read from the named pipe, up to the maximum read size set in the request. A write request returns after writing data to the named pipe without waiting for the data to be consumed. Named pipe non-blocking raw writes are not allowed. Raw writes MUST be performed in blocking mode. If not set, a read or a raw read request will wait (block) until sufficient data to satisfy the read request becomes available, or until the request is canceled. A write request blocks until its data is consumed, if the write request length is greater than zero.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB1.TransactionSubcommandName.TRANS_MAILSLOT_WRITE
member.summary: The 0x0001 subcommand code is interpreted as TRANS_MAILSLOT_WRITE if the operation is being performed on a mailslot. The same code is interpreted as a TRANS_SET_NMPIPE_STATE (section 2.2.5.1) if the operation is performed on a named pipe.

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB1.UTimeHelper
member.summary: UTime - The number of seconds since Jan 1, 1970, 00:00:00

member.name: M:SMBLibrary.SMB2.SMB2Command.GetCommandChainBytes(System.Collections.Generic.List{SMBLibrary.SMB2.SMB2Command},System.Byte[],SMBLibrary.SMB2.SMB2Dialect)
member.param: Message will be signed using this key if (not null and) SMB2_FLAGS_SIGNED is set.
Used for signature calculation when applicable.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB2.SMB2Dialect.SMB2xx
member.summary: indicates that the server implements SMB 2.1 or future dialect revisions and expects the client to send a subsequent SMB2 Negotiate request to negotiate the actual SMB 2 Protocol revision to be used. The wildcard revision number is sent only in response to a multi-protocol negotiate request with the "SMB 2.???" dialect string.

member.summary: Encyrpt message and prefix with SMB2 TransformHeader

member.name: T:SMBLibrary.SMB2.SMB2TransformHeader
member.summary: Used by the client or server when sending encrypted messages. only valid for the SMB 3.x dialect family.

member.name: F:SMBLibrary.SMB2.CreateContext.Next
member.summary: The offset from the beginning of this Create Context to the beginning of a subsequent 8-byte aligned Create Context. This field MUST be set to 0 if there are no subsequent contexts.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4
member.summary: Implements the MD4 message digest algorithm in C#

ol.li: Ronald L. Rivest, " The MD4 Message-Digest Algorithm", IETF RFC-1320 (informational).

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4.BLOCK_LENGTH
member.summary: The size in bytes of the input block to the transformation algorithm

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4.buffer
member.summary: 512-bit input buffer = 16 x 32-bit words holds until it reaches 512 bits

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4.count
member.summary: Number of bytes procesed so far mod. 2 power of 64.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4.#ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.MD4)
member.summary: This constructor is here to implement the clonability of this class

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4.EngineReset
member.summary: Resets this object disregarding any temporary data present at the time of the invocation of this call.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4.EngineUpdate(System.Byte)
member.summary: Continues an MD4 message digest using the input byte
member.param: byte to input

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4.EngineUpdate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.remarks: Continues an MD4 message digest operation by filling the buffer, transform(ing) data in 512-bit message block(s), updating the variables context and count, and leaving (buffering) the remaining bytes in buffer for the next update or finish.
member.param: input block
start of meaningful bytes in input
count of bytes in input blcok to consider

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.MD4.EngineDigest
member.summary: Completes the hash computation by performing final operations such as padding. At the return of this engineDigest, the MD engine is reset.
member.returns: the array of bytes for the resulting hash value.
